Nice work! I've put a link on the RVE forum OP!

Awesome Thanks
Totally trying now!

Congrats man!! I fully back this project, and I'm curious as to if you need any input on anything? I'm not sure what will be come of my cloud pack with the up coming release of KSPRC and WIP EVE. I'm thinking about disbanding it in the future for a better (wink wink) alternative such as this. If you ever need tileable texture or more clouds, feel free to use the files in ACP freely with exception of the main kerbin cloud texture, which is sadly not under my authority to hand out.

Best of luck with this man.
woah this is cool omg

Congrats man!! I fully back this project, and I'm curious as to if you need any input on anything? I'm not sure what will be come of my cloud pack with the up coming release of KSPRC and WIP EVE. I'm thinking about disbanding it in the future for a better (wink wink) alternative such as this. If you ever need tileable texture or more clouds, feel free to use the files in ACP freely with exception of the main kerbin cloud texture, which is sadly not under my authority to hand out.

Best of luck with this man.

I'll happily take any input anybody has, always best to get multiple angles on a project! Also, thanks for the offer and if I ever need it I will definitely ask and/or look at what ACP has Thanks again

Hmmm... Are you running any flags for your KSP? AKA -force-putyourgraphicsapihere or anything else?

- - - Updated - - -

YES! That is all I can say. I will try this mod out in a separate KSP game since my main one has over 25+ mods. Can't wait. Great job!

Awesome Let me know what you think

Hmmm... Are you running any flags for your KSP? AKA -force-putyourgraphicsapihere or anything else?

Through Steam, yes. I'm running -force-opengl. Admittedly, I haven't tried running it with this flag disabled. Do you think that could be it? I will try another build with -force-opengl disabled just to be sure...

Through Steam, yes. I'm running -force-opengl. Admittedly, I haven't tried running it with this flag disabled. Do you think that could be it? I will try another build with -force-opengl disabled just to be sure...

Yeah try it without it. I've run into multiple issues with multiple things on OpenGL and Dx11 instead of the default Dx9

So for this you need the EnvironmentalVisualEnchancements folder ONLY from the EVE Overhaul branch, the SVE BoulderCo folder and optionally scatterer? Also, do you have to press Alt+E and then Apply as with RVE? Other than that AWESOME!!!

So for this you need the EnvironmentalVisualEnchancements folder ONLY from the EVE Overhaul branch, the SVE BoulderCo folder and optionally scatterer? Also, do you have to press Alt+E and then Apply as with RVE? Other than that AWESOME!!!

That is correct, and no, you shouldn't have to press Alt+E and then apply. It should work out of the box.

Yeah try it without it. I've run into multiple issues with multiple things on OpenGL and Dx11 instead of the default Dx9

Ok. Figured it out. Not an add-on conflict, and not -force-openGL. SVE is dependent on the in-game terrain settings. I had all my terrain settings as low as they could go. With the default terrain settings, it looks like it should I believe. Any reason this is?

Ok. Figured it out. Not an add-on conflict, and not -force-openGL. SVE is dependent on the in-game terrain settings. I had all my terrain settings as low as they could go. With the default terrain settings, it looks like it should I believe. Any reason this is?

Huh... Weird. I'm going to guess that its something to do with EVE-Overhaul. I never tested that as I have it all on high. I'd go check the EVE-Overhaul thread to see if there is anything in there on that.

Are those auroras I see???

Nope... Aliens

Huh... Weird. I'm going to guess that its something to do with EVE-Overhaul. I never tested that as I have it all on high. I'd go check the EVE-Overhaul thread to see if there is anything in there on that.

Ah. Yes. Hadn't though about that. Probably EVE. Thanks.

Ah. Yes. Hadn't though about that. Probably EVE. Thanks.

Let me know if you find anything. If it is EVE I'll be sure to add it to the known issues.

I started work on getting clouds and textures on Eve. I don't have any pictures of it to share yet because I'm not happy with how it looks right now. However, if you feel like taking the time all of the dev files are on GitHub so you can download the master zip (not the release) and use that to see what they look like.
